text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This is a new IRM section within the 4.31 Pass-Through Entity Handbook to implement the Section 1101 of the Bipartisan Budget Act (BBA) of 2015.
) This IRM contains internal control information per IRM
, Address Management and Internal Controls, and early election guidance. (
) Future revisions will be expanded to include more detailed BBA guidance.
Future revisions will be expanded to include more detailed BBA guidance.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This IRM incorporates Interim Guidance Memo LB&I-04-0719-006, Interim Guidance on Initial in Partnership Examinations and Elections into the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015 (BBA) Audit Regime.
Partnership Audit Regime (BBA) Field Procedures 4.31.9 page

Purpose: The purpose of this IRM is to provide ﬁeld examination procedures, processes and guidelines to LB&I and SB/SE employees who examine part- nership returns under the centralized partnership audit regime.
The following tables list commonly used terms and acronyms:

Acronym Deﬁnition AAR Administrative Adjustment Request BBA Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015 CPF Campus Pass-Through Function DI Designated Individual ECI Effectively Connected Income EPR Entity Partnership Representative FDAP Fixed, Determinable, Annual or Periodical FPA Notice of Final Partnership Adjustment ILSC Investor Level Statute Control IPR Individual Partnership Representative IU Imputed Underpayment IUA Imputed Underpayment Amount LEP LB&I Examination Process NAP Notice of Administrative Proceeding NIIT Net Investment Income Tax NOPPA Notice of Proposed Partnership Adjustment POA Power of Attorney POC Point of Contact PR Partnership Representative PRI Partnership-Related Item SECA Self-Employed Contribution Act SRS Specialist Referral System TCS Tax Computation Specialist TIN Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number TS Technical Services

) This subsection addresses elections into the BBA by partnerships for tax periods beginning after November
and before January
) Section
) of the BBA provides that partnerships may “early elect in” have the BBA apply to partnerships with returns ﬁled for tax periods after November
and before January
Per Treas. Reg.
, generally this election may only be made within
days of the date the IRS ﬁrst notiﬁes a partnership in writing that its return has been selected for examination. (

) Either the Tax Matters Partner (TMP) or an individual authorized to sign the partnership return for the taxable year under examination is authorized to make this election for any partnership return ﬁled for tax periods beginning after November
and before January

A Power of Attorney, in general, does not have the authority to make this election. The fact that an dividual dates and signs the election statement under penalty of perjury shall be prima facie evidence that the individual is authorized to make the election on behalf of the partnership. See Treas. Reg.
) This election may be made within

days of the date the IRS ﬁrst notiﬁes partnership in writing that the partnership has been selected for examination. This election can be made for any timely ﬁled, late ﬁled or non-ﬁled return as long as the election is made within

days from the date of notiﬁcation of the selection for examination. The date that the return is ﬁled or a substitute for return is prepared does not matter for purposes of election. The election must be provided to the individual identiﬁed in such notice as the IRS contact for the examination. Treas. Reg.
(a) states that partnerships may not request an extension of time for making this election. (
) After January
, this election may also be made when ﬁling an trative Adjustment Request (AAR) under IRC
as amended by the BBA tax periods beginning after November
and before January
See IRM
for details. (
) This election may not be made if, prior to making such election: • An AAR has been ﬁled (or deemed to have been ﬁled) on behalf of a TEFRA partnership under IRC
(c) (prior to amendment by the BBA), or • An amended return of a non-TEFRA partnership has been ﬁled (or deemed to have been ﬁled) under IRC
. For the rules regarding when an AAR or amended return is deemed to have been ﬁled, see Treas. Reg.
). Internal Revenue Manual
Partnership Audit Regime (BBA) Field Procedures 4.31.9 page
This subsection addresses elections into the BBA by partnerships for tax periods beginning after November 2, 2015 and before January 1, 2018.
An AAR has been ﬁled (or deemed to have been ﬁled) on behalf of TEFRA partnership under IRC
(c) (prior to amendment by the BBA), or An amended return of a non-TEFRA partnership has been ﬁled (or deemed to have been ﬁled) under IRC
For the rules regarding when an AAR or amended return is deemed to have been ﬁled, see Treas. Reg. 301.9100-22(c)(4).

-D. • “Election under Section
)” must be at the top of the • The statement must be dated and signed by the TMP or an individual that has the authority to sign the partnership return for the taxable under examination. The Form

days from the date of the Letter
-D. If the election is mailed, the date of the postmark should be used to determine if timely ﬁled. (
) Once made, this election may only be revoked with the consent of the Revenue Service. See Treas. Reg.
(a). Examiners should ately contact a BBA point of contact if they subsequently receive a request to revoke the election. (
) Pursuant to Treas. Reg.

)(ii), the election statement must include: to be • The partnership’s name, taxpayer identiﬁcation number and in the Election taxable year to which the election statement applies. • The name, address, daytime telephone number and taxpayer tion number of the partnership representative under IRC

(as amended by the BBA) for the taxable year to which the election statement applies. • A representation that the partnership is not insolvent and does not sonably anticipate becoming insolvent before resolution of any adjustment for the partnership taxable year for which the election is being made. • A representation that the partnership is not currently and does not sonably anticipate becoming subject to a bankruptcy petition or involuntary) under Title

of the United States Code. • A representation that the partnership has sufficient assets, and ably anticipates having sufficient assets, to pay a potential imputed underpayment that may be determined during the partnership tion. • Has sufficient assets, and reasonably anticipates having sufficient assets, to pay a potential imputed underpayment that may be deter- mined during the partnership examination. • The name, taxpayer identiﬁcation number, address and telephone number of the individual who signs the election statement. • A representation signed under penalties of perjury that the individual signing the election statement is duly authorized to make the election and that, to the best of their knowledge and belief, the election statement is true, correct and complete. To make the election, the partnership can use Form 7036, Election Under Section 1101(g)(4) of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2015. If Form 7036 is not used, the partnership may prepare its own statement:
The election must be in writing and include a statement that the partner- ship is electing to have the BBA apply to the partnership return for the taxable year identiﬁed in the IRS Letter
-D. “Election under Section

)” must be at the top of the statement. The statement must be dated and signed by the TMP or an individual that has the authority to sign the partnership return for the taxable year under examination.

)(ii), the election statement must The partnership’s name, taxpayer identiﬁcation number and partnership taxable year to which the election statement applies. The name, address, daytime telephone number and taxpayer identiﬁca- tion number of the partnership representative under IRC

(as amended by the BBA) for the taxable year to which the election statement applies. A representation that the partnership is not insolvent and does not rea- sonably anticipate becoming insolvent before resolution of any adjustment for the partnership taxable year for which the election is being made. A representation that the partnership is not currently and does not rea- sonably anticipate becoming subject to a bankruptcy petition (voluntary or involuntary) under Title

of the United States Code. A representation that the partnership has sufficient assets, and reason- ably anticipates having sufficient assets, to pay a potential imputed underpayment that may be determined during the partnership examina- tion. Has sufficient assets, and reasonably anticipates having sufficient assets, to pay a potential imputed underpayment that may be deter- mined during the partnership examination. The name, taxpayer identiﬁcation number, address and telephone number of the individual who signs the election statement. A representation signed under penalties of perjury that the individual signing the election statement is duly authorized to make the election and that, to the best of their knowledge and belief, the election statement is true, correct and complete.
Partnership Audit Regime (BBA) Field Procedures 4.31.9 page 5
Immediately notify the IRS “BBA point(s) of contact (BBA POC)” desig- nated to monitor elections and/or provide subject matter expertise

Immediately notify the IRS “BBA point(s) of contact (BBA POC)” desig- nated to monitor elections and/or provide subject matter expertise regarding the BBA. Verify that no AAR or amended return was ﬁled (or deemed to have been ﬁled) by the partnership for the partnership taxable year for which an election is being made. If Form
is used by the taxpayer to make the election, ensure all required elements are properly completed. If Form
is not used, ensure the election statement complies with the requirements of Treas. Reg.
as previously discussed. If additional information is needed, and time permitting, the taxpayer should be notiﬁed as soon as possible. All required information must received within
days of the date of the IRS notice of selection for examination for the election to be valid. There is no extension to this

-day period. Confer with your manager and determine whether the election statement is valid. If so, provide a copy of the valid election statement to the BBA POC. If the election is invalid, contact the BBA POC for next steps and follow the existing TEFRA or non-TEFRA procedures accordingly.

is used by the taxpayer to make the election, ensure all required elements are properly completed. • If Form
is not used, ensure the election statement complies with the requirements of Treas. Reg.
as previously discussed. • If additional information is needed, and time permitting, the taxpayer should be notiﬁed as soon as possible. All required information must received within
days of the date of the IRS notice of selection for examination for the election to be valid. There is no extension to this

-day period. • Confer with your manager and determine whether the election statement is valid. If so, provide a copy of the valid election statement to the BBA POC. • If the election is invalid, contact the BBA POC for next steps and the existing TEFRA or non-TEFRA procedures accordingly. (

days after a valid election is received before a notice of administrative proceeding (NAP) in case the partnership wants to ﬁle an AAR under IRC
as amended by the BBA. During this
-day period, the examiner should conduct a cursory check to ensure that the part- nership representative identiﬁed on Form
or other election statement meets the requirements of Treas. Reg.
)(ii)(D). This cursory check will include basic research to ensure the name, taxpayer identiﬁcation number, address, and daytime telephone number of the partnership tative are correct. (

, Related Resources, for links to additional procedures. (
) This subsection describes procedures for examiners and managers when an AAR is ﬁled under the BBA (BBA AAR) with respect to partnership taxable Made years beginning after November
and before January
where the partnership elects to be subject to the BBA for such taxable year. (
) Treas. Reg.

provides that a partnership may ﬁle a BBA AAR for an eligible tax year to have the BBA apply to that tax year. A partnership not ﬁle a BBA AAR solely for the purpose of changing the designation of the partnership representative as described in IRC
as amended by the (

) Only partnerships may ﬁle a BBA AAR. A partner may ﬁle a BBA AAR on behalf of the partnership if they are acting in the capacity of a PR or the partner is the TMP ﬁling an AAR for an eligible tax year together with an election into the BBA. See Treas. Reg.
) Generally, under IRC
(c) as amended by BBA, a partnership may ﬁle a BBA AAR within
years after the later of (
) the date of ﬁling the return, or (
) the due date of the return without regard to extensions. A ship that receives a notiﬁcation of selection for examination (Letter
-D) partnership taxable years beginning after November
and before January
may elect to apply the BBA to the partnership return ﬁled that tax year within
days from the date of the Letter
-D. Once a valid election is made, the partnership has
more days to ﬁle a BBA AAR. (
) In no event, may a partnership ﬁle a BBA AAR after a Notice of Proceeding (Letters
and
-A) has been mailed by the IRS for that partnership taxable year. (

) A BBA AAR should be ﬁled with the IRS service center where the original return was ﬁled. In the case of a BBA AAR ﬁled for a tax year after being selected for examination (but before the NAP has been issued), the partner- ship should also provide a copy of the BBA AAR to the revenue agent. (
) If the AAR is ﬁled electronically, the partnership uses Form
, U.S. of Partnership Income (marking the amended return box), and Form
, Notice of Inconsistent Treatment or Administrative Adjustment Request (marking the BBA AAR box in Part
and completing the appropriate items a-e). The partnership also includes a statement, “Election under Section
)”, with the required information. The
instructions to Form provide details on requirements. (
) If the AAR is ﬁled on paper, the partnership uses Form
X, Amended Return or Administrative Adjustment Request (AAR), marks the BBA AAR in Part I, completes the appropriate items a-e in Section
, and completes IV (if necessary). The phrase “Election under Section
),” should be written across the top of the Form
X and a statement attached with the required information. The
instructions to Form
X provide details requirements. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
D
Associate election with related items in the ﬂow-thru administrative ﬁle or workpapers. LB&I examiners will use SAIN
and UIL
B SB/SE examiners will use Section

) For information regarding eligibility to elect into the BBA and for how to an election, see Treas. Reg.
and IRM
) If an examiner is assigned a BBA AAR for examination that was ﬁled with service center on or after

, they should immediately notify the BBA POC. The BBA POC will assist the examiner on how to: • Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is valid and includes all of the information required by the statute and applicable regulations. • Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is timely ﬁled. Ensure that the BBA AAR ﬁled before the issuance of the NAP when the tax year is under nation. • Discuss if an update to the statute of limitations (SOL) on making ad- justments under IRC
)(C) is appropriate and if so, how to update that SOL. • Proceed with the examination. (

) If an examiner receives a BBA AAR directly from the taxpayer they are auditing, they should immediately notify the BBA POC. The BBA POC will assist the examiner on how to do the following and determine next steps: • Conﬁrm whether the BBA AAR was ﬁled with the Service Center and so, assist the agent with requesting a copy from the Service Center reconciliation purposes. If the taxpayer ﬁles the original BBA AAR directly with the examining agent, the agent should date stamp the make a copy for the case ﬁle and forward the AAR to the Service Center where the original return was ﬁled • Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is valid and includes all the information required by the statute and applicable regulations. • Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is timely ﬁled. Ensure that the BBA AAR ﬁled before the issuance of the NAP when the tax year is under nation. • Discuss if an update to the statute of limitations (SOL) on making ad- justments under IRC
)(C) is appropriate and if so, how to update that SOL.
For information regarding eligibility to elect into the BBA and for how to make an election, see Treas. Reg. 301.9100-22 and IRM 4.31.9.2.

, they should immediately notify the BBA POC. The BBA POC will assist the examiner on how to:

Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is valid and includes all of the information required by the statute and applicable regulations. Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is timely ﬁled. )(C) is appropriate and if so, how to update that SOL. Proceed with the examination. an examiner receives a BBA AAR directly from the taxpayer they are

If an examiner receives a BBA AAR directly from the taxpayer they are auditing, they should immediately notify the BBA POC. The BBA POC will assist the examiner on how to do the following and determine next steps:

• Conﬁrm whether the BBA AAR was ﬁled with the Service Center and if so, assist the agent with requesting a copy from the Service Center for reconciliation purposes. If the taxpayer ﬁles the original BBA AAR directly with the examining agent, the agent should date stamp the make a copy for the case ﬁle and forward the AAR to the Service Center where the original return was ﬁled • Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is valid and includes all the information required by the statute and applicable regulations. • Conﬁrm that the BBA AAR is timely ﬁled. Ensure that the BBA AAR ﬁled before the issuance of the NAP when the tax year is under exami- nation. • Discuss if an update to the statute of limitations (SOL) on making ad- justments under IRC
)(C) is appropriate and if so, how to update that SOL.
